item.title: Bench360: Benchmarking Local LLM Inference from 360{\deg}
item.description: arXiv:2511.16682v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Running large language models (LLMs) locally is becoming increasingly common. While the growing availability of small open-source models and inference engines has lowered the entry barrier, users now face an overwhelming number of configuration choice...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, summarization, reasoning, platform, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. item.title: Shona spaCy: A Morphological Analyzer for an Under-Resourced Bantu Language
item.description: arXiv:2511.16680v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Despite rapid advances in multilingual natural language processing (NLP), the Bantu language Shona remains under-served in terms of morphological analysis and language-aware tools. item.title: A Vector Symbolic Approach to Multiple Instance Learning
item.description: arXiv:2511.16795v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) tasks impose a strict logical constraint: a bag is labeled positive if and only if at least one instance within it is positive. While this iff constraint aligns with many real-world applications, recent work has shown ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> vector, arxiv, framework, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 60%</small>
